body:
I don't think this is worth the effort. This is an extreme corner case, involving two odd cases:

* you have imports where the import path base doesn't match the package name
* you're hacking on a project without its dependencies already installed.

None of those happen often. If it does, you can use your version control system to revert to where you were, run `git get .` to get the necessary dependencies, and start again.
